2011-11-03, SGSN-MME 2012A. QNILSTE: GTPv2 added to CAUSE_PROT_TYPE (for use in ACTIVATE event). MSISDN added to all MME L_ events.

2012-05-02, SGSN-MME 13A. EMWTEND: Enhanced comment field information. QNILSTE: SRVCC parameters added in L_HANDOVER event, GTP_PIGGYBACKED added in L_DEDICATED_BEARER_ACTIVATE event. ERVLLHE: MSC and TARGET_LAI added to L_ATTACH and L_TAU for combined event info.

2012-06-21, SGSN-MME 13A. EMWTEND: Enhanced comment field information. QNILSTE: SRVCC parameters added in L_HANDOVER event, GTP_PIGGYBACKED added in L_DEDICATED_BEARER_ACTIVATE event. Event L_BEARER_MODIFY added. ERVLLHE: MSC and TARGET_LAI added to L_ATTACH and L_TAU for combined event info.
2012-06-26, SGSN-MME 13A. EMWTEND: Enhanced description field information for the BEARER_CAUSE parameter
2012-10-28, SGSN-MME 13B. PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER added to L_ATTACH and L_TAU. SERVICE_REQUEST: 3G Direct Tunnel info added

parametertype.name: RECORD_LENGTH
parametertype.description: Total number of bytes in this binary

parametertype.name: FILE_FORMAT_VERSION
parametertype.description: The file format version is incremented if there is a change in the file format - changes in file structure that requires updates of the controlling XML schema.

parametertype.name: FILE_INFORMATION_VERSION
parametertype.description: The file information version is incremented if there is a change in the file information, e.g. new events or parameters in events.

parametertype.name: TIME_YEAR
parametertype.description: Year

parametertype.name: TIME_MONTH
parametertype.description: Month

parametertype.name: TIME_DAY
parametertype.description: Year

parametertype.name: TIME_HOUR
parametertype.description: Timestamp (Hour) at the time when the signaling procedure for the event was started (Hour. HH)

parametertype.name: TIME_MINUTE
parametertype.description: Timestamp (Minute) at the time when the signaling procedure for the event was started (Minute. MM)

parametertype.name: TIME_SECOND
parametertype.description: Timestamp (Second) at the time when the signaling procedure for the event was started (Second. SS)

parametertype.name: TIME_MILLISECOND
parametertype.description: Timestamp (MilliSecond) at the time when the signaling procedure for the event was started (Millisecond)

parametertype.name: DURATION
parametertype.description: Duration provides timing information with millisecond granularity calculated from when the signaling procedure starts until it ends for the event.

parametertype.name: UE_RETURN_DURATION
parametertype.description: This parameter provides a period of time in milliseconds from the time when the MME receives a UE Context Release Request message with a cause code configured in the MME by the S1RelCauseDelayGbrBearerDeact parameter, to the time when the UE reconnects to the network. If the actual UE return duration exceeds the upper limit of 65535 milliseconds, the MME still records the UE return duration as 65535 milliseconds in the Event-Based Monitoring Log file. The precondition for this parameter to be present is that the Timer Based Deactivation of GBR Bearers feature is active and the UE has GBR bearer(s) when S1 connection is releasing.

parametertype.name: DURATION_PSM
parametertype.description: This parameter provides timing information in seconds calculated from when the UE enters PSM until the UE exits PSM.

parametertype.name: ACTIVE_TIMER
parametertype.description: Active timer provides timing information in seconds of how long time a PSM-type UE is active before it enters PSM.

parametertype.name: PERIODIC_RAU_TIMER
parametertype.description: The value of the periodic RAU timer, which is sent to the UE in the Periodic RA update timer or T3312 extended value IEs.

parametertype.name: FILE_TERMINATION_CAUSE
parametertype.description: Reason for ending the logging

parametertype.name: RECORD_TYPE
parametertype.description: Record type

parametertype.name: EVENT_ID
parametertype.description: Event identity

parametertype.name: RAT
parametertype.description: Radio Access Type, either GSM or WCDMA

parametertype.name: EVENT_RESULT
parametertype.description: Result of the Event Procedure

parametertype.name: CAUSE_PROT_TYPE
parametertype.description: Protocol type of the failure cause.

parametertype.name: PAGING_ATTEMPTS
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of the Paging procedures that have been performed. Due to range limit and BC reason, the PAGING_ATTEMPTS cannot reflect the real number. The real number can be PAGING_ATTEMPTS OR PAGING_ATTEMPTS plus 8.

parametertype.name: PAGING_ATTEMPTS_ENB
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of paging attempts to the Last Visited eNodeB in the used paging profile.

parametertype.name: PAGING_ATTEMPTS_ENB_LIST
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of paging attempts to the Last Visited eNodeB List or the Probabilistic eNodeB List in the used paging profile.

parametertype.name: PAGING_ATTEMPTS_TA
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of paging attempts to the Last Visited TA in the used paging profile.

parametertype.name: PAGING_ATTEMPTS_TA_LIST
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of paging attempts to the Last Visited TA List in the used paging profile.

parametertype.name: PAGING_ENB_LIST_SELECTION
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates whether the paging attempt is performed based on the Latest Visited eNodeB List or the Probabilistic eNodeB List.

parametertype.name: ENB_SN
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the serial number of the eNodeB, which returns the paging response, among the Latest Visited eNodeB List or the Probabilistic eNodeB List including the last visited eNodeB. The ENB_SN parameter and the ENB_SN_EXT parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: ENB_SN_EXT
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the serial number of the eNodeB, which returns the paging response, among the Probabilistic eNodeB List. The ENB_SN_EXT parameter and the ENB_SN parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: ENB_LIST_LENGTH
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of the latest visited eNodeB in the Latest Visited eNodeB List or the number of the eNodeBs selected for paging attempt from the Probabilistic eNodeB List including the last visited eNodeB. The ENB_LIST_LENGTH parameter and the ENB_LIST_LENGTH_EXT parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: ENB_LIST_LENGTH_EXT
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of the eNodeBs selected for paging attempt from the Probabilistic eNodeB List including the last visited eNodeB. The ENB_LIST_LENGTH_EXT parameter and the ENB_LIST_LENGTH parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: L_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE
parametertype.description: This information element indicates from which protocol the cause code originates

parametertype.name: CS_FALLBACK_SERVICE_TYPE
parametertype.description: This information element indicates the service type in extended service request message

parametertype.name: SERVICE_REQUEST_TYPE
parametertype.description: This information element indicates the type of service request message that triggered the service request event

parametertype.name: CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Reason for failure" information using 3GPP defined cause codes. In order to get the protocol from where the Cause Code in an event originates, the parameter value of "CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" or "L_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" should be analyzed.

parametertype.name: CAUSE_CODE2
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Reason for failure" information using 3GPP defined cause codes. In order to get the protocol from where the Cause Code in an event originates, the parameter value of "CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" or "L_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" should be analyzed.

parametertype.name: SUB_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides "Detailed reason for failure" information. This information should be analyzed together with the "Cause Code" parameter and the "CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" or "L_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" parameter.

parametertype.name: BEARER_ID
parametertype.description: The EPS Bearer ID identifies one of several bearers in a bearer setup list

parametertype.name: BEARER_QCI
parametertype.description: Provides information on a QoS class identifier for each bearer in a bearer setup list

parametertype.name: ARP_PRIORITY_LEVEL
parametertype.description: Provides information on Priority Level of Allocation and Retention Priority for each bearer in a bearer setup list

parametertype.name: ARP_PCI
parametertype.description: Provides information on Pre-emption-Capability of Allocation and Retention Priority for each bearer in a bearer setup list

parametertype.name: ARP_PVI
parametertype.description: Provides information on Pre-emption-Vulnerability of Allocation and Retention Priority for each bearer in a bearer setup list

parametertype.name: GBR_UPLINK
parametertype.description: Provides Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink (kbps) for each GBR bearer in a bearer setup list

parametertype.name: GBR_DOWNLINK
parametertype.description: Provides Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink (kbps) for each GBR bearer in a bearer setup list for bit rates up to 10,000,000 kbps.

parametertype.name: BEARER_CAUSE
parametertype.description: Provides success/failure information for each bearer in a bearer setup list.

parametertype.name: GTP_PIGGYBACKED
parametertype.description: Indicates if the dedicated bearer activation was done in parallel with the default bearer activation as a result of a piggybacked Create Bearer Request or not

parametertype.name: MCC
parametertype.description: Mobile Country Code.

parametertype.name: MNC
parametertype.description: Mobile Network Code.

parametertype.name: LAC
parametertype.description: Location Area Code

parametertype.name: RAC
parametertype.description: Routing Area Code

parametertype.name: RNCID
parametertype.description: RNC ID

parametertype.name: CI
parametertype.description: Cell Identity

parametertype.name: SAC
parametertype.description: Service Area Code

parametertype.name: IMSI
parametertype.description: International Mobile Subscriber Identity. This information element contains information which is commonly used to identify the UE in the CN.

parametertype.name: PTMSI
parametertype.description: Packet-Temporary Mobile Subscriber Identity

parametertype.name: IMEISV
parametertype.description: International Mobile Equipment Identity Software Version

parametertype.name: MSISDN
parametertype.description: Mobile Subscriber Integrated Services Digital Network Number

parametertype.name: STN_SR
parametertype.description: Session Transfer Number for SR-VCC

parametertype.name: HLR
parametertype.description: Home Location Register address
parametertype.detaileddescription: 9 octets, TBCD (Telephony Binary Coded Decimal) NULL-padding (x00) for unused characters upto a total length of 18 octets. No HLR is indicated with (xFF).

parametertype.name: APN
parametertype.description: This parameter specifies the resulting APN after APN Resolving.

parametertype.name: MS_REQUESTED_APN
parametertype.description: This parameter specifies the APN the MS requested. The parameter is included in a successful event when the MS-requested APN is different from the resulting APN after APN Resolving. The parameter is also included in a rejected event with cause code 27 (UNKNOWN_OR_MISSING_APN) or cause code 33 (REQUESTED_SERVICE_OPTION_NOT_SUBSCRIBED).

parametertype.name: UE_REQUESTED_APN
parametertype.description: This parameter specifies the APN the UE requested. The parameter is always included if the UE-requested APN exists. The parameter is displayed as "NULL" when the UE-requested APN is empty or in incorrect format.

parametertype.name: GSN
parametertype.description: GSN IP address (a.b.c.d)

parametertype.name: IPV4
parametertype.description: IP address V4

parametertype.name: IPV6
parametertype.description: IP address V6

parametertype.name: DIRECT_TUNNEL
parametertype.description: Indicates if direct tunnel is capable or not to setup for the activated PDP

enumeration.enum: Direct tunnel is incapable to be used
Direct tunnel is capable to be used

parametertype.name: TRANSFERRED_PDP
parametertype.description: Number of transferred PDP Contexts

parametertype.name: DROPPED_PDP
parametertype.description: Number of dropped PDP Contexts

parametertype.name: ATTACH_TYPE
parametertype.description: GPRS attach type, either GPRS attach, GPRS attach while IMSI is attached, or Combined GPRS IMSI attach

parametertype.name: ACTIVATION_TYPE
parametertype.description: Primary,Network initiated or MS initiated Secondary PDP Context

parametertype.name: PDP_CONTEXT_REQUEST_TYPE
parametertype.description: PDP context request type, initial activate a PDP context, or handover from a non-3GPP access network.

enumeration.enum: UE request a new PDP context

parametertype.name: INTRA_RAU_TYPE
parametertype.description: Indicates whether it's an Inter System Change or not (GSM and WCDMA)

parametertype.name: UPDATE_TYPE
parametertype.description: Routing Area Update type

enumeration.enum: Combined Ra La Update with Imsi

parametertype.name: DEACTIVATION_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Deactivation Trigger. The value represents the initiated origin for deactivation.

parametertype.name: HOMEZONE_IDENTITY
parametertype.description: Homezone identity. A name for the current homezone.

parametertype.name: L_ATTACH_TYPE
parametertype.description: EPS attach type, either EPS attach, Combined EPS IMSI attach or EPS emergency attach.

parametertype.name: PDN_CONNECT_REQUEST_TYPE
parametertype.description: Request type according to 3GPP 24.008.

enumeration.enum: UE request new connectivity to a PDN
UE request new connectivity to a PDN providing emergency bearer services
UE requests a transfer of an emergency PDN connection from non-3GPP access to 3GPP access

parametertype.name: TAC
parametertype.description: Tracking Area Code. This element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area Code.

parametertype.name: ECI
parametertype.description: E-UTRAN Cell Identity. Used to identify cells within a PLMN.

parametertype.name: MMEGI
parametertype.description: MME Group ID.

parametertype.name: MMEC
parametertype.description: MME Code

parametertype.name: MTMSI
parametertype.description: M-Temporary Mobile Subscriber Identity

parametertype.name: L_DETACH_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: EPS Detach Trigger. The value represents the initiated origin for detach.

parametertype.name: L_DETACH_TYPE
parametertype.description: EPS Detach Type

parametertype.name: HANDOVER_TYPE
parametertype.description: Type of Handover

parametertype.name: HANDOVER_RAT_CHANGE_TYPE
parametertype.description: RAT Change Type of Handover

parametertype.name: HANDOVER_SGW_CHANGE_TYPE
parametertype.description: SGW Change Type of Handover

parametertype.name: SRVCC_TYPE
parametertype.description: SRVCC PS to CS HANDOVER TYPE

parametertype.name: HANDOVER_NODE_ROLE
parametertype.description: The role of the node generating this event in the handover.

enumeration.enum: The source MME in an inter node handover
The target MME in an inter node handover
The MME in an intra node handover

parametertype.name: TAU_TYPE
parametertype.description: Tracking Area Update Type

parametertype.name: COMBINED_TAU_TYPE
parametertype.description: Combined Tracking Area Update Type. When included, indicates the type of a combined TAU procedure the SGSN-MME has successfully handled.

enumeration.enum: Combined Ta La Update with Imsi

parametertype.name: SMS_ONLY
parametertype.description: This event parameter indicates that the SGSN-MME has successfully handled an EPS attach or combined Attach or TAU procedure for EPS services and SMS only or an Attach or TAU procedure for SMS only.

parametertype.name: DONAS
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates if the UE is granted use of the Data over NAS feature, or if the UE supports but is not granted use of the Data over NAS feature.

parametertype.name: CONNECTION_SUSPEND_AND_RESUME
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates if the UE is granted use of the Connection Suspend and Resume feature, or if the UE supports but is not granted the Connection Suspend and Resume feature.

parametertype.name: L_DEACTIVATION_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: EPS Deactivation Trigger

parametertype.name: REQUEST_RETRIES
parametertype.description: Number of retry messages that are initiated by the UE

parametertype.name: NSAPI
parametertype.description: Network Service Access Point Identifier

parametertype.name: DETACH_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Origin of Detach initiation

parametertype.name: SERVICE_REQ_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Origin of Service Request initiation

parametertype.name: L_SERVICE_REQ_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Origin of LTE Service Request initiation

parametertype.name: L_SERVICE_REQ_TRIGGER2
parametertype.description: Origin of LTE Service Request initiation

parametertype.name: L_OPTIMIZED_SERVICE_REQ_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Origin of LTE Service Request initiation

parametertype.name: DETACH_TYPE
parametertype.description: Detach Type

enumeration.enum: MS initiated normal combined GPRS IMSI Detach
MS initiated power off GPRS Detach
MS initiated power off IMSI Detach
MS initiated power off combined GPRS IMSI Detach

parametertype.name: SERVICE_TYPE
parametertype.description: Service Request Type for GSM and WCDMA

parametertype.name: DECONNECT_PDN_TYPE
parametertype.description: PDN Disconnection type

parametertype.name: BYTE_HOUR
parametertype.description: Timestamp, Hour. HH

parametertype.name: BYTE_MINUTE
parametertype.description: Timestamp, Minute. MM

parametertype.name: BYTE_SECOND
parametertype.description: Timestamp, Second. SS

parametertype.name: ERROR_TYPE
parametertype.description: Error type

parametertype.name: CAUSE_OF_HEADER
parametertype.description: Reason why a header record is sent in the stream

parametertype.name: NODE_ID
parametertype.description: Node Id of the SGSN-MME.

parametertype.name: TIME_ZONE
parametertype.description: Time-zone of the SGSN-MME.

parametertype.name: NUMBER_OF_DROPPED_EVENTS
parametertype.description: Indicates how many events that have been lost during a period before the streaming was functional again.

parametertype.name: PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER
parametertype.description: The value of the periodic TAU timer, which is sent to the UE in the T3412 value IE. The PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER parameter and the PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: RELIABILITY_CLASS
parametertype.description: Reliability Class in R97/98 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: DELAY_CLASS
parametertype.description: Delay Class in R97/98 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: PRECEDENCE_CLASS
parametertype.description: Precedence Class in R97/98 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: PEAK_THROUGHPUT
parametertype.description: Peak Throughput in R97/98 QoS profile, represent the Peak Throughput Class 1 to 9.

parametertype.name: MEAN_THROUGHPUT
parametertype.description: Mean Throughput in R97/98 QoS profile, represent the Mean Throughput Class 1 to 18. Mean Throughput Class 30 is reserved and 31 is best effort.

parametertype.name: DELIVERY_OF_ERR_SDU
parametertype.description: Delivery of erroneous SDUs in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: DELIVERY_ORDER
parametertype.description: Delivery Order in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: TRAFFIC_CLASS
parametertype.description: Traffic Class in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: MAX_SDU_SIZE
parametertype.description: Maximum SDU size in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: BITRATE
parametertype.description: Bitrate in kbps.

parametertype.name: RESIDUAL_BER
parametertype.description: Residual Bit Error Rate in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: SDU_ERROR_RATIO
parametertype.description: SDU error ratio in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: TRAFFIC_HANDLING_PRIORITY
parametertype.description: Traffic handling priority in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: TRANSFER_DELAY
parametertype.description: Transfer delay in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: SOURCE_STATISTICS_DESCRIPTOR
parametertype.description: Source Statistics Descriptor in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: SIGNALLING_INDICATION
parametertype.description: Signalling Indication in R99 QoS profile.

parametertype.name: CDMA2000_TYPE
parametertype.description: CDMA2000 Type

parametertype.name: A21_MESSAGE_TYPE
parametertype.description: A21 Message Type

parametertype.name: EVENT_NOTIFICATION_CAUSE
parametertype.description: A21 Event Notification Cause

parametertype.name: SEND_ATTEMPTS
parametertype.description: Number of attempts to send an A21 message to current IWS that are initiated by the MME

parametertype.name: MARKET_ID
parametertype.description: Market ID. This element is used to uniquely identify a Market ID.

parametertype.name: SWITCH_NUMBER
parametertype.description: Switch number. This element is used to uniquely identify a Switch Number.

parametertype.name: CELL
parametertype.description: Cell. This element is used to uniquely identify a Cell.

parametertype.name: SECTOR
parametertype.description: Sector. This element is used to uniquely identify a Sector.

parametertype.name: ORIGINATING_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE
parametertype.description: Protocol type of a peer failure cause, or other originating cause type.

parametertype.name: ORIGINATING_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This information element provides peer "Reason for failure" information using 3GPP defined cause codes, or other originating cause. In order to get the protocol from where the peer Cause Code in an event originates or other originating cause type, the parameter value of "ORIGINATING_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" should be analyzed.

parametertype.name: UE_RESTORATION
parametertype.description: Indicates UE restoration occurred in Service Request or TAU procedure

parametertype.name: SGW_RELOCATION
parametertype.description: Indicates SGW relocation occurred due to S11 or S4 link down or SGW restarted.

parametertype.name: HANDOFF_STATUS
parametertype.description: The handover status for the S102 interface

parametertype.name: SRVCC_HANDOVER
parametertype.description: Indicates that the UE wants to perform a SRVCC Handover to 1xRTT.

parametertype.name: EMERGENCY
parametertype.description: Indicates if current procedure is related to an IMS emergency call.

parametertype.name: CSG_ID
parametertype.description: Closed Subscriber Group Identity

parametertype.name: TARGET_CSG_ID_FROM_SOURCE
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and included to indicate the CSG ID of the target cell that the target MME receives from the source S4-SGSN/MME during IRAT/inter-MME S1-based handover procedures or the MME receives from the source HeNB/HeNB GW during the intra-MME S1-based handover procedure.

parametertype.name: CELL_ACCESS_MODE
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and included to indicate in which access mode the UE is accessing a cell.

parametertype.name: CSG_MEMBERSHIP_STATUS
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and included to indicate the CSG membership status when the UE is accessing a hybrid cell. The CSG membership status indicates whether the UE is a member of the hybrid cell. It is also used if the UE is in the CSG cell without membership.

parametertype.name: CSFB_TRIGGERED
parametertype.description: Indicates if an IRAT HO from LTE was triggered in relation to CSFB.

enumeration.enum: The HO was not triggered in relation to CSFB
The HO was triggered in relation to CSFB

parametertype.name: SX_FAILURE_REASON
parametertype.description: Reason for Sx/Smp session establishment failure

enumeration.enum: Other Failure Result Code Included in CCA

parametertype.name: SX_EVENT_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Event trigger armed by the Sx/Smp peer

parametertype.name: SX_EVENT_REPORT_MODE
parametertype.description: Mode of event reporting

parametertype.name: SAPC_NUMBER
parametertype.description: Locally configured SapcNumber

parametertype.name: PGW_FROM_SAPC
parametertype.description: This event parameter indicates that the SAPC provides the PGW address.

parametertype.name: GW_FROM_SAPC
parametertype.description: This event parameter indicates that the SAPC provides GGSN/PGW address.

parametertype.name: PRA_ID
parametertype.description: Presence Reporting Area Identifier

parametertype.name: PRA_MODE
parametertype.description: This event parameter indicates how the PRA is defined.

parametertype.name: PDP_STATUS
parametertype.description: This event parameter indicates which PDP contexts are activated for a certain Sx/Smp session. The values of bit0 to bit4 are reserved as "0". The value of each bit from bit5 to bit15 indicates the status of PDP context. For example, if bit5 is set to 1, it means that the PDP context with NSAPI 5 belongs to the Sx/Smp session.

parametertype.name: HOME_ENODEB_ID
parametertype.description: the Home eNodeB ID

parametertype.name: MACRO_ENODEB_ID
parametertype.description: the Macro eNodeB ID

parametertype.name: IS_IMEISV_CHANGED
parametertype.description: This event parameter indicates that if MME detects the IMEISV change in the GUTI Attach or inter TAU procedure.

parametertype.name: BACK_OFF_TIMER
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and is included in the T3346 IE to indicate the value of the back-off timer that the MME sends to the UE.

parametertype.name: NAS_SIGNALING_LOW_PRIORITY
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and is included in the Device Properties IE to indicate the NAS signaling priority value of UE, which is sent from the UE to the MME.

parametertype.name: SDS_SERVICE
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and indicates an SDS-capable UE.

parametertype.name: SDS_GW
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and indicates the SDS GW in use.

parametertype.name: DATA_SERVICE_TYPE
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and indicates the type of data service that triggers the Control Plane Service Request procedure.

parametertype.name: DATA_LENGTH
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and indicates the length of the EPS user data that is carried in the Control Plane Service Request message.

parametertype.name: SMS_LENGTH
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and indicates the length of the SMS message that is carried in the Control Plane Service Request message.

parametertype.name: PREVIOUS_S1_RELEASE_TRIGGERED_NODE
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the node that triggered the previous S1 release procedure.

parametertype.name: PREVIOUS_S1_RELEASE_CAUSE
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the cause for the previous S1 release. Each value stands for a cause. For the mapping between the value and the cause, see section S1AP Cause Codes in EBM Cause Codes.

parametertype.name: IDLE_DURATION_SINCE_PREVIOUS_S1_RELEASE
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the duration for which the UE has been in the ECM-IDLE state since the previous S1 release. The duration is measured in milliseconds. If the actual duration exceeds the upper limit, the MME records the duration as the upper limit.

parametertype.name: A_MSISDN
parametertype.description: Additional Mobile Subscriber Integrated Services Digital Network Number

parametertype.name: EDRX_TEDRX_REQ
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the requested value of the eDRX cycle parameter (TeDRX).

parametertype.name: EDRX_TEDRX
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the value of the negotiated eDRX cycle parameter (TeDRX).

parametertype.name: EDRX_PTW_REQ
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the requested length of the eDRX paging time window in milliseconds.

parametertype.name: EDRX_PTW
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the length of the negotiated paging time window in milliseconds used for UEs in eDRX mode.

parametertype.name: EDRX_DELAY_PAGING_TIME
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the time, in seconds, the MME delays the paging procedure for a UE using eDRX mode. It specifies the time from the original paging request, until the first paging attempt (UE not responding), or until the UE becomes available.

parametertype.name: EDRX_STATUS
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates whether the eDRX mode is activated for the MS.

parametertype.name: EDRX_CYCLE_VALUE
parametertype.description: The eDRX cycle value for the MS, as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008.

parametertype.name: EDRX_CYCLE_LENGTH
parametertype.description: The eDRX cycle length for the MS, in milliseconds.

parametertype.name: DECOR_RESULT
parametertype.description: Result of DECOR Procedure.

enumeration.enum: UE is accepted to continue the procedure with the supported UE Usage Type.
UE is accepted to continue the procedure though the UE Usage Type is not supported ortheMMEGI is mismatching.
UE is rejected due to unsupported UE Usage Type or mismatched MMEGI.
UE is accepted due to its UUT is included in exceptional list.
UE is rejected due to its UUT is included in exceptional list.
UE should be reselected to other DCN by TAU.

parametertype.name: DECOR_MMEGI
parametertype.description: MME Group ID of rerouting. This parameter is not present if it equals to the local MME Group ID.

parametertype.name: DECOR_UE_USAGE_TYPE
parametertype.description: UE Usage Type used in DECOR procedure.

parametertype.name: ENB_UE_S1AP_ID
parametertype.description: The eNodeB UE S1 Application Protocol Identity information element is used to uniquely identify UE over the S1 interface within an eNodeB.

parametertype.name: MME_UE_S1AP_ID
parametertype.description: The MME UE S1 Application Protocol Identity information element is used to uniquely identify UE over the S1 interface within the MME.

parametertype.name: UE_REQUESTED_ROHC_MAX_CID
parametertype.description: This parameter specifies the UE requested MAX_CID for the PDN connection.

parametertype.name: ROHC_UDP
parametertype.description: ROHC header compression profile UDPIP indicator which UE requests.

parametertype.name: UE_SUPPORT_WITHOUT_PDN
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates that the UE supports EMM REGISTERED without PDN connection according to the UE network capability IE in the Attach Request or TAU Request message.

enumeration.enum: UE does not support EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection.
UE supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection.

parametertype.name: ESM_DUMMY_MSG_IN_REQ
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates that the ESM message container IE in the Attach Request message includes ESM dummy message.

enumeration.enum: ESM message container does not include ESM DUMMY MESSAGE
ESM message container includes ESM DUMMY MESSAGE

parametertype.name: ROHC_ESP
parametertype.description: ROHC header compression profile ESPIP indicator which UE requests.

parametertype.name: ROHC_IP
parametertype.description: ROHC header compression profile IP indicator which UE requests.

parametertype.name: ROHC_TCP
parametertype.description: ROHC header compression profile TCPIP indicator which UE requests.

parametertype.name: ROHC_UDP_V2
parametertype.description: ROHC header compression profile UDPIP_V2 indicator which UE requests.

parametertype.name: ROHC_ESP_V2
parametertype.description: ROHC header compression profile ESPIP_V2 indicator which UE requests.

parametertype.name: ROHC_IP_V2
parametertype.description: ROHC header compression profile IP_V2 indicator which UE requests.

parametertype.name: L_RAT
parametertype.description: Radio Access Type, either wideband or narrowband

parametertype.name: LTE_M_UE_INDICATION
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates if the UE is a Cat-M UE or not.

parametertype.name: NR_AS_SECONDARY_RAT
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates whether the UE is restricted from using NR as Secondary RAT.

parametertype.name: UE_SUPPORT_DCNR
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates whether the UE supports dual connectivity with NR according to the UE Network Capability IE in the Attach Request or TAU Request message.

enumeration.enum: UE supports dual connectivity with NR
UE does not support dual connectivity with NR

parametertype.name: UE_SUPPORT_N1
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates whether the UE supports N1 mode or not.

enumeration.enum: UE does not support N1 mode

parametertype.name: UE_5GS_SUBS
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates whether the UE has 5GS subscription or not.

enumeration.enum: The UE does not have 5GS subscription

parametertype.name: APN_5GS_SUBS
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates whether the APN configuration for current PDN supports interworking with 5GS or not.

enumeration.enum: APN subscription data supports interworking with 5GS
APN subscription data does not support interworking with 5GS

parametertype.name: PDN_TYPE
parametertype.description: The actual used PDN Type is displayed if available, otherwise the PDN Type requested by the UE is displayed.

parametertype.name: EXT_GBR_DOWNLINK
parametertype.description: Provides extended Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink (kbps) for each GBR bearer in a bearer setup list, for bit rates higher than 10,000,000 kbps.

parametertype.name: EDRX_TEDRX_SUB
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the HSS-subscribed value of the eDRX cycle length parameter (TeDRX).

parametertype.name: EDRX_PTW_SUB
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the HSS-subscribed value of the eDRX paging time window length parameter in milliseconds.

parametertype.name: ACTIVE_TIMER_REQ
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the UE-requested value of the timing information in seconds of how long time a PSM-type UE is active before it enters PSM.

parametertype.name: PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_REQ
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the UE-requested value of the periodic TAU timer, which is included in the T3412 extended value IE if it is sent to the UE. The PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_REQ parameter and the PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT_REQ parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: ACTIVE_TIMER_SUB
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the HSS-subscribed value of the timing information in seconds of how long time a PSM-type UE is active before it enters PSM.

parametertype.name: PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_SUB
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the HSS-subscribed value of the periodic TAU timer, which is included in the T3412 extended value IE if it is sent to the UE. The PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_SUB parameter and the PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT_SUB parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: SMS_IN_MME_REGISTERED
parametertype.description: This parameter is optional and included to indicate if SMS in MME is registered or deregistered.

parametertype.name: PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the extended value range of the periodic TAU timer, which is sent to the UE in the T3412 value IE. The PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT parameter and the PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT_REQ
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the extended value range of the UE-requested periodic TAU timer, which is included in the T3412 extended value IE if it is sent to the UE. The PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT_REQ parameter and the PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_REQ parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT_SUB
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the extended value range of the HSS-subscribed periodic TAU timer, which is included in the T3412 extended value IE if it is sent to the UE. The PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT_SUB parameter and the PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_SUB parameter are mutually exclusive.

parametertype.name: S1_MODE_REG
parametertype.description: This information element obtained from attach request or TAU request message indicates the UE registration statusin EPS.

enumeration.enum: UE is not in EMM-REGISTERED state.

parametertype.name: N1_MODE_REG
parametertype.description: This information element obtained from attach request or TAU request message indicates the UE registration statusin 5GS.

parametertype.name: MODIFICATION_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Modification Trigger. The value represents the initiated origin for modification.

parametertype.name: ACTIVATION_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Activation Trigger. The value represents the initiated origin for activation.

parametertype.name: HOST
parametertype.description: This information element contains the hostname of GMLC.

parametertype.name: REALM
parametertype.description: This information element contains the realm of GMLC.

parametertype.name: SCEF_HOST
parametertype.description: This information element contains the hostname of SCEF.

parametertype.name: SCEF_REALM
parametertype.description: This information element contains the realm of SCEF.

parametertype.name: LOCATION_EVENT
parametertype.description: This Information Element contains the type of event that triggers the location procedure.

parametertype.name: TARGET_SERVING_NODE_TYPE
parametertype.description: This information element contains the type of the target-side serving node for handover of an IMS emergency call.

parametertype.name: L_RAT_TYPE
parametertype.description: Radio Access Type, either LTE-WB, NB-IOT or LTE-M.

parametertype.name: COVERAGE_LEVEL
parametertype.description: This information element contains the type of the requested coverage level.

parametertype.name: LCS_REFERENCE_NUMBER
parametertype.description: This information element contains the reference number identifying the deferred location request or identifying the request for which delayed location reporting for temporarily unreachable UEs is supported.

parametertype.name: TERMINATION_CAUSE
parametertype.description: This information element contains the reason why the MME ended the Mobile-Terminated Location Request procedure.

parametertype.name: SLG_LOCATION_TYPE
parametertype.description: This information element contains the type of location measurement requested, such as current location, initial location, last known location, etc.

parametertype.name: LCS_CLIENT_TYPE
parametertype.description: This information element contains the type of LCS client initiating the positioning request.

parametertype.name: LCS_CLIENT_NAME
parametertype.description: This information element contains the name of the LCS client initiating the positioning request.

parametertype.name: LOCATION_REPORTING_DELAYED
parametertype.description: This information element indicates whether location reporting is delayed because the UE is temporarily unreachable.

parametertype.name: AGE_OF_LOCATION_ESTIMATE
parametertype.description: This information indicates the how long ago the location estimate was obtained in minutes

parametertype.name: N_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates to which protocol the cause code applies.

parametertype.name: N_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This parameter provides "Reason for failure" information using3GPPdefined cause codes. In order to get the protocol to where the cause code in an event applies, the parameter value of "N_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" must be analyzed.

parametertype.name: N_SUB_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This parameter provides "Detailed reason for failure" information. This information can be analyzed together with the "N_CAUSE_CODE" parameter and the "N_CAUSE_PROT_TYPE" parameter.

parametertype.name: N_TAC
parametertype.description: Tracking Area Code. This parameter together with the "MCC" and "MNC" parameters, is used to uniquely identify a tracking area identity.

parametertype.name: NCI
parametertype.description: NR Cell Identity. This parameter is used to identify cells within a PLMN.

parametertype.name: AMF_REGION_ID
parametertype.description: AMF Region ID.

parametertype.name: AMF_SET_ID
parametertype.description: AMF Set ID.

parametertype.name: AMF_POINTER
parametertype.description: AMF Pointer.

parametertype.name: N_TMSI
parametertype.description: Temporary Mobile Subscriber Identity for 5GS.

parametertype.name: SUPI_IMSI
parametertype.description: SUPI consisting of IMSI. This parameter contains information which is commonly used to identify the subscriber in the core network.

parametertype.name: PEI_IMEISV
parametertype.description: PEI consisting of IMEISV. This parameter contains information which is commonly used to identify the UE and the UE software version.

parametertype.name: MSISDN_ASCII
parametertype.description: Mobile Subscriber Integrated Services Digital Network Number.

parametertype.name: ORIGINATING_PROT_TYPE
parametertype.description: The protocol type of a peer failure cause, or other originating cause type.

parametertype.name: ORIGINATING_NF_SERVICE_NAME
parametertype.description: The name of the service from which AMF receives a failure indication or no response.

parametertype.name: ORIGINATING_NF_SERVICE_INSTANCE_ID
parametertype.description: The identifier of the service instance from which AMF receives a failure indication or no response. If the AMF uses indirect communication through SCPs and the failure originator is an SCP or an SEPP, this parameter is set to undefined.

parametertype.name: ORIGINATING_NF_INSTANCE_ID
parametertype.description: The identifier of the network function instance from which AMF receives a failure indication or no response. This parameter represents an identifier, that is globally unique inside the PLMN of the NRF where the network function is being registered. The NRF provides this identifier. If the AMF uses indirect communication through SCPs and the failure originator is an SCP or an SEPP, this parameter is set to undefined.

parametertype.name: N_ORIGINATING_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: This parameter provides peer "Reason for failure" information using 3GPP defined cause codes, or other originating cause. In order to get the protocol from where the peer cause code in an event originates or other originating cause type, the parameter value of "ORIGINATING_PROT_TYPE" must be analyzed.

parametertype.name: HTTP_PROBLEM_DETAILS_CAUSE
parametertype.description: The cause in HTTP2 ProblemDetails structure. The AMF can receive this parameter from a peer network function or service together with a HTTP2 status code which is included in the "N_ORIGINATING_CAUSE_CODE" parameter.

parametertype.name: SERVICE_QUERIED
parametertype.description: The service that the AMF requests from the Nnrf_NFDiscovery service. This parameter is used when the AMF receives a failure indication or no response from the NRF.

parametertype.name: EMERGENCY_REGISTRATION
parametertype.description: This parameter specifies if the UE is registered using emergency registration.

parametertype.name: MICO_MODE
parametertype.description: MICO Mode indication sent to the UE when the UE requests MICO mode.

parametertype.name: PERIODIC_REGISTRATION_UPDATE_TIMER
parametertype.description: The value of the periodic registration update timer, which is sent to the UE in the T3512 value IE. This value is given in seconds.

parametertype.name: GNODEB_UE_NGAP_ID
parametertype.description: This parameter corresponds to the gNodeB UE N2 Application Protocol Identity IE, which uniquely identifies the UE over the N2 interface within a gNodeB.

parametertype.name: AMF_UE_NGAP_ID
parametertype.description: This parameter corresponds to the AMF UE N2 Application Protocol Identity IE, which uniquely identifies the UE over the N2 interface within the AMF.

parametertype.name: GTPC_TEID
parametertype.description: GTPC Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

parametertype.name: DEREGISTRATION_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: The value represents the initiator of the deregistration.

parametertype.name: SWITCH_OFF
parametertype.description: Switch-off indicator sent from the UE to the network.

parametertype.name: REREGISTRATION_REQUIRED
parametertype.description: Re-registration indicator sent from the network to the UE.

parametertype.name: ACCESS_TYPE
parametertype.description: The access-type for which the deregistration applies.

parametertype.name: PDU_SESSION_ID
parametertype.description: The identifier of the PDU session.

parametertype.name: DNN
parametertype.description: The Data Network Name.

parametertype.name: SST
parametertype.description: Slice or Service Type.

parametertype.name: SD
parametertype.description: Slice Differentiator.

parametertype.name: SMF_NF_INSTANCE_ID
parametertype.description: The parameter represents an identifier that is unique inside the PLMN of the NRF where the SMF for this PDU is being registered. The NRF provides this identifier.

parametertype.name: SMF_SERVICE_INSTANCE_ID
parametertype.description: Identifier of the SMF Service Instance serving the PDU.

parametertype.name: DNN_SELECTION_MODE
parametertype.description: The DNN selection mode.

parametertype.name: N_HANDOVER_TYPE
parametertype.description: Type of Handover.

parametertype.name: N_HANDOVER_NODE_ROLE
parametertype.description: The role of the node generating this event in the handover.

enumeration.enum: The source AMF in an inter AMF handover
The target AMF in an inter AMF handover
The AMF in an intra AMF handover

parametertype.name: N_HANDOVER_RAT_CHANGE_TYPE
parametertype.description: RAT Change Type of Handover.

parametertype.name: EPS_FALLBACK_TRIGGERED
parametertype.description: Indicates if an HO to LTE was triggered by EPS FallBack.

enumeration.enum: The HO was not triggered by EPS FallBack
The HO was triggered by EPS FallBack

parametertype.name: SHORT_MACRO_ENODEB_ID
parametertype.description: the Short macro eNodeB ID.

parametertype.name: LONG_MACRO_ENODEB_ID
parametertype.description: the Long macro eNodeB ID.

parametertype.name: ASSIGNED_EBI
parametertype.description: Indicates if this EBI is assigned to one specified PDU session.

enumeration.enum: This EBI is not assigned to one specified PDU session.
This EBI is assigned to one specified PDU session

parametertype.name: SECURITY_MODE_CMP_CONTAINER
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates that the MME receives the Security Mode Complete message with the Replayed NAS message container IE.

enumeration.enum: SMC with Replayed NAS message container

parametertype.name: PDU_SESSION_CAUSE
parametertype.description: Provides success/failure information for each PDU session.

parametertype.name: GAD_SHAPE
parametertype.description: This information element provides the Geographical Area Description shape defined in TS 23.032

enumeration.enum: Ellipsoid Point With Altitude And Uncertainty Elipsoid
High Accuracy Ellipsoid Point With Uncertainty Ellipse
High Accuracy Ellipsoid Point With Altitude And UncertaintyEllipsoid

parametertype.name: SLICE_SELECTION_RESULT
parametertype.description: Result of NSSelection Procedure.

parametertype.name: TARGET_AMF_SET_ID
parametertype.description: Target AMF Set ID.

parametertype.name: TARGET_AMF_INSTANCE_ID
parametertype.description: Target AMF Instance ID.

parametertype.name: REGISTERED_S_NSSAIS
parametertype.description: Registered S-NSSAIs.

parametertype.name: REQUESTED_S_NSSAIS
parametertype.description: Requested S-NSSAIs.

parametertype.name: REJECTED_S_NSSAIS
parametertype.description: Rejected S-NSSAIs.

parametertype.name: DOMAIN
parametertype.description: Always '0' for SGSN-MME/PC MM. Used to distinguish between various NF's in flexible deployments. Possible values 0 -SGSN-MME/PC MM, 1 -PC SM and 2 -UPF

parametertype.name: GNODEB_ID
parametertype.description: GnodeB_ID

parametertype.name: TSC
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates type of security context flag in MME Security Context.

parametertype.name: REPREFI
parametertype.description: This parameter indicatesthat the MME received a Return Preferred Indication (REPREFI) fora UE to the last used 5GS PLMN at a laterhandover to a shared EPSnetwork.

enumeration.enum: Return to the last used EPS or 5GS PLMN

parametertype.name: PDU_SESSION_REACTIVATION_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the trigger of the PDU Session Reactivation procedure.

enumeration.enum: UE Requested and Pending Downlink Data.

parametertype.name: PDU_SESSION_REACTIVATION_RESULT
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the reactivation result for each PDU session.

enumeration.enum: The PDU Session Reactivation procedure succeded.
The PDU Session Reactivation procedure failed.

parametertype.name: PDU_SESSION_REACTIVATION_RESULT_CAUSE
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the session management cause sent to the NGRAN, giving additional information about the reactivation result.

parametertype.name: N_SERVICE_REQUEST_TYPE
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the type of Service Request message that triggered the Service Request procedure.

parametertype.name: N_SERVICE_REQUEST_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the Service Request procedure trigger.

parametertype.name: PDU_SESSION_MISMATCH_CAUSE
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the reason for the PDU session mismatch. If the reason is set to 1, this PDU session is removed from the network side.

parametertype.name: ISMF_SELECTION_RESULT
parametertype.description: This parameter provides the result of the I-SMF Selection procedure. If the result is "Change", the I-SMF instance identifies the new I-SMF.

parametertype.name: IS_PEI_CHANGED
parametertype.description: The parameter is set when the AMF detects that the UE has changed the PEI. The first time the AMF receives PEI is not treated as PEI change.

parametertype.name: PAGING_PROFILE_ID
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the ID of a paging profile that is selected for a paging attempt.

parametertype.name: PAGING_WIDTH
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the width of a paging attempt.

parametertype.name: PAGING_ATTEMPT_SEQUENCE
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the sequence of a paging attempt in one paging width.

parametertype.name: NUMBER_OF_PAGED_ENB
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of eNodeBs that are paged in a paging attempt.

parametertype.name: L_PAGING_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Origin of LTE Paging initiation.

parametertype.name: ENB_SERIAL_NUMBER
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the serial number of the eNodeB, which returns the paging response, among the Latest-Visited eNodeB List or the Probabilistic eNodeB List including the Last-Visited eNodeB.

parametertype.name: SMS_OVER_NAS_ALLOWED
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates if SMS over NAS is allowed for this UE.

parametertype.name: FQDN
parametertype.description: FQDN of SMF or I-SMF in use.

parametertype.name: FORWARDED_5G_BEARER_TO_3G
parametertype.description: A bearer that is only available in the EPS and 5GS networks is included in a Forward Relocation Request message in the Handover procedure from LTE to WCDMA or SRVCC procedure from LTE to WCDMA with Packet-Switched Handover.

parametertype.name: N_PAGING_ATTEMPTS
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the number of the Paging procedures that have been performed.

parametertype.name: N_PAGING_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the original NF or AMF Service of Paging procedure.

parametertype.name: N_PAGING_TRIGGER_MESSAGE_CLASS
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the N1 or N2 Message Class, which is triggering the paging procedure.

parametertype.name: N_TOTAL_NO_OF_PAGED_NGRAN_NODE
parametertype.description: This parameter indicates the total number of NG-RAN are paged. Usually, it equals the number of paging requests sent to the NG-RAN nodes.

event.name: ATTACH
event.comment: The GSM/WCDMA Attach procedure. The Attach procedure attaches the MS to the SGSN and announces the presence of the MS in the Packet-Switched (PS) network.

event.name: ACTIVATE
event.comment: The GSM/WCDMA PDP Context Activation procedure. The PDP Context Activation procedure establishes a virtual data channel between the MS and a Packet Data Network (PDN) through the General Packet Radio Service (GPRS) network. A successful PDP context activation enables the subscriber to communicate with the corresponding PDN, announcing the presence of the MS in the GGSN. Event-Based Monitoring supports the following PDP context activation procedures and corresponding QOS layout: - Primary PDP context activation, with QOS_REQUESTED, QOS_NEGOTIATED and QOS_EPS_NEGOTIATED(S4 only) - MS-initiated Secondary PDP activation, with QOS_REQUESTED and QOS_NEGOTIATED - Network-requested Secondary PDP activation, with QOS_REQUESTED and QOS_NEGOTIATED for Gn, with QOS_EPS_REQUESTED, QOS_NEGOTIATED and QOS_EPS_NEGOTIATED for S4

event.name: RAU
event.comment: The GSM/WCDMA Routing Area Update (RAU) procedure. The RAU procedure updates the SGSN with information on the routing area in which the MS is located. The RAU event supports the following RAU procedures: - Normal - Periodic

event.name: ISRAU
event.comment: The GSM/WCDMA Inter SGSN Routing Area Update (ISRAU) procedure. The ISRAU procedure updates the SGSN with information on when an MS moves between routing areas controlled by different SGSNs.

event.name: DEACTIVATE
event.comment: The GSM/WCDMA PDP Context Deactivation procedure. The PDP Context Deactivation procedure revokes the virtual data channel between the MS and PDN, preventing the subscriber from communicating with PDNs.

event.name: L_ATTACH
event.comment: The LTE Attach procedure. The Attach procedure for LTE Access initiated by the User Equipment (UE) establishes a connection between the UE and the MME announcing the presence of the UE in the EPS.

event.name: L_DETACH
event.comment: The LTE Detach procedure. The Detach procedure for LTE Access revokes the connection between the UE and the MME. The UE is detached either explicitly or implicitly. The detach procedure may be initiated by the UE, MME, SGSN or by the Home Subscriber Server (HSS).

event.name: L_HANDOVER
event.comment: The LTE Handover procedure. The UE Handover procedure results in the handover of the UE from a source eNodeB to a target eNodeB over the S1 or X2 interface, or IRAT PS handover between LTE and WCDMA (the event is triggered in the MME regardless of direction of the IRAT) when the UE changes its location. The event is also used for the SRVCC Handover signalling procedure and in the CP Relocation procedure when an NB-IoT UE has control plane connections only. In this event, some parameters provide source information and target information. The type and amount of the information that can be provided by this event depends on HANDOVER_NODE_ROLE and HANDOVER_RAT_CHANGE_TYPE. The source information can be provided by parameters OLD_TAI, OLD_MMEGI, OLD_MMEC, OLD_S_GW,OLD_MTMSI,OLD_ECI, and OLD_SGSN. The target information can be provided by parameters TAI, MMEGI, MMEC, S_GW, MTMSI, ECI, TARGET_RNC_ID, TARGET_GLOBAL_ENB_ID, and SGSN.

event.name: L_TAU
event.comment: The LTE Tracking Area Update (TAU) procedure. The TAU procedure updates the MME with information on the tracking area in which the UE is located. The procedure is started by the UE when it enters a tracking area outside its current Tracking Area Identity (TAI) list or when the periodic TAU timer has expired. Event-Based Monitoring supports the following TAU procedures: - Periodic TAU - Intra-MME TAU - Inter-MME TAU

event.name: L_DEDICATED_BEARER_ACTIVATE
event.comment: The LTE Dedicated Bearer Activation procedure. One default bearer is established through the Attach or Standalone PDN Connectivity procedure. When the UE or the network requests services, additional bearers need to be established on the PDN connection. These bearers are referred to as dedicated bearers. They are activated through the Dedicated Bearers Activation procedure, or as part of the Attach or Standalone PDN Connectivity procedures in case of GTP_PIGGYBACKED == Piggybacked. This event is triggered in all these scenarios.

event.name: L_DEDICATED_BEARER_DEACTIVATE
event.comment: The LTE Dedicated Bearer Deactivation procedure. The Dedicated Bearer Deactivation procedure is initiated by the PGW or MME to remove dedicated bearers for a PDN connection. This procedure only removes dedicated bearers, no default bearers, for the PDN connection.

event.name: L_PDN_CONNECT
event.comment: The LTE Standalone PDN Connectivity procedure. The PDN Connectivity procedure initiated by the UE is used when the UE is attached in the network and requests set up of additional PDN connections.

event.name: L_PDN_DISCONNECT
event.comment: The LTE PDN Disconnection procedure. The PDN Disconnection procedure initiated by the UE, MME, PGW or SCEF is used when the UE is attached in the network and the UE, MME, PGW or SCEF requests disconnection of PDN connections.

event.name: L_SERVICE_REQUEST
event.comment: The LTE UE-Initiated Service Request, Network-Initiated Service Request (including Paging), Extended Service Request and Control Plane Service Request procedures. The UE-Initiated Service Request procedure is used when UE in ECM-IDLE state attempts to send user data or short messages. It can also be used when the UE in ECM-IDLE state wants to send uplink signaling messages to reestablish one or several EPS bearers. The Service Request procedure is also used as a Paging Response message when preceded by a paging procedure. A successful UE-Initiated Service Request procedure changes the ECM state to ECM-CONNECTED, allowing the UE to send or receive data or signaling. The Extended Service Request message is sent from the UE to the MME to support CS Fallback service. The Control Plane Service Request is sent from the UE to the MME to support Data over NAS service.

event.name: DETACH
event.comment: The GSM/WCDMA Detach procedure. The Detach procedure disconnects the MS from the PS network. If the Gs interface between SGSN and MSC exists, the MS can also be disconnected from the CS network on command. Event-Based Monitoring supports the detach procedures initiated by the MS, HLR, SGSN, or MSC: - MS-initiated GPRS detach procedure - Network-initiated GPRS detach procedure

event.name: SERVICE_REQUEST
event.comment: The WCDMA Service Request procedure. The Service Request procedure is used when a WCDMA Systems MS wants to send user data or a paging response. It can also be used when it wants to send uplink signaling messages when in PMM-IDLE state (for example, to reestablish a PDP context), or when no Radio Access Bearer (RAB) exists for a PDP context. Event-Based Monitoring supports the following Service Request procedures: - MS-initiated Service Request procedure - Network-initiated paging procedure

event.name: L_BEARER_MODIFY
event.comment: The LTE PGW-Initiated Bearer Modification procedure or the SCEF-Initiated T6a Connection Update procedure. The PGW-Initiated Bearer Modification procedure is used when one or several of the EPS Bearer QoS parameters or APN-AMBR or TFT is to be modified. The SCEF-Initiated T6a Connection Update procedure is used to update the parameters (e.g. Extended PCO information) associated to a T6a connection between the MME and the SCEF. This event will be generated before MME sends Update Bearer Response to SGW during the PGW-Initiated Bearer Modification procedure or before MME sends Connection Management Answer to SCEF during the SCEF-Initiated T6a Connection Update procedure.

event.name: L_CDMA2000
event.comment: The LTE CDMA2000 Uplink and Downlink procedures. The CDMA2000 procedure provides a tunnel for sending and receiving messages between the UE and the 1xRTT CS System. The procedure also includes sending of Event Notification from MME to 1xIWS in CS System to inform about UEs relocated to this MME or UEs leaving LTE. Event-Based Monitoring supports the following CMDA2000 procedures: - Downlink - Uplink

event.name: EXIT_PSM
event.comment: The GSM EXIT_PSM event. The event announces that MS is activated after a period of power saving

event.name: L_CONNECTION_RESUME
event.comment: The LTE Connection Resume procedure. The Connection Resume procedure is initiated by the eNodeB, and is used to request the S1 connection of a UE attached to the network to be resumed. The L_CONNECTION_RESUME event records the resume procedures triggered by an S1-AP UE Context Resume Request message or an S1-AP Path Switch Request message with RRC Resume Cause IE. The Path Switch Request message with RRC Resume Cause IE also triggers an X2-based Handover procedure. The X2-based Hanover procedure is recorded in the L_HANDOVER event.

event.name: L_LCS_SUBSCRIBER_LOCATION_REPORT
event.comment: The LCS Subscriber Location Report sub-procedure. The Subscriber Location Report sub-procedure is initiated by the MME to provide the location of a target UE to a GMLC, when a request for location has been implicitly issued or when a Delayed Location Reporting is triggered after receipt of a request for location for a UE transiently not reachable.

event.name: L_LCS_PROVIDE_SUBSCRIBER_LOCATION
event.comment: The LCS Provide Subscriber Location sub-procedure. The Provide Subscriber Location sub-procedure is initiated by the GMLC to request the location of a target UE from the MME as part of EPC-MT-LR positioning procedure.

event.name: AMF_INITIAL_REGISTRATION
event.comment: AMF initial registration event

event.name: AMF_DEREGISTRATION
event.comment: AMF deregistration event

event.name: AMF_PDU_SESSION_ESTABLISHMENT
event.comment: AMF PDU session establishment event This event is generated after the Nsmf_PDUSession_CreateSMContext service operation during the AMF PDU Session Establishment procedure.

event.name: AMF_HANDOVER
event.comment: AMF handover event

event.name: AMF_SERVICE_REQUEST
event.comment: AMF service request event

event.name: L_PAGING
event.comment: The LTE paging procedure. For the OPTIONAL_UEID EBM event parameter group, MTMSI is always logged if available. If IMSI is available and logged, IMEISV and MSISDN are omitted. If IMSI is not available, IMEISV is logged but MSISDN is omitted. For the TAI EBM event parameter group, if the EBM event L_SERVICE_REQUEST is generated or the paging procedure is unsuccessful, this event parameter group is not logged. For the ECI EBM event parameter, if the EBM event L_SERVICE_REQUEST is generated or the paging procedure is unsuccessful, this event parameter is not logged.

event.name: AMF_PAGING
event.comment: The AMF paging procedure. For the N_UEID EBM event parameter group, N_TMSI is always logged if available. If SUPI_IMSI is available and logged, PEI_IMEISV and MSISDN are omitted. If SUPI_IMSI is not available, PEI_IMEISV is logged but MSISDN is omitted. For the N_TAI EBM event parameter group, if the EBM event AMF_SERVICE_REQUEST is generated or the paging procedure is unsuccessful, this event parameter group is not logged. For the NCI EBM event parameter, if the EBM event AMF_SERVICE_REQUEST is generated or the paging procedure is unsuccessful, this event parameter is not logged.

event.name: L_OPTIMIZED_SERVICE_REQUEST
event.comment: The LTE UE-Initiated Service Request, Network-Initiated Service Request, Extended Service Request and Control Plane Service Request procedures. The UE-Initiated Service Request procedure is used when UE in ECM-IDLE state attempts to send user data or short messages. It can also be used when the UE in ECM-IDLE state wants to send uplink signaling messages to reestablish one or several EPS bearers. The Service Request procedure is also used as a Paging Response message when preceded by a paging procedure. A successful UE-Initiated Service Request procedure changes the ECM state to ECM-CONNECTED, allowing the UE to send or receive data or signaling. The Extended Service Request message is sent from the UE to the MME to support CS Fallback service. The Control Plane Service Request is sent from the UE to the MME to support Data over NAS service. The extended part includes the following paremeters: PLMN parameter group, MMEI parameter group, S_GW parameter group, S11_SGW_GTP_C_TEID, S11_MME_GTP_C_TEID, BEARERS parameter group, UE_RESTORATION, SGW_RELOCATION, PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER, PERIODIC_TAU_TIMER_EXT, ACTIVE_TIMER, EDRX_TEDRX, EDRX_PTW, L_RAT, NR_AS_SECONDARY_RAT, UE_SUPPORT_DCNR, LTE_M_UE_INDICATION, UE_SUPPORT_N1, and UE_5GS_SUBS. The rest parameters are included in the basic part.
